solution_line_template: The total number of bottles containing cider or beer is {only_cider_bottles}+{only_beer_bottles} = <<{only_cider_bottles}+{only_beer_bottles}={cider_and_beer_bottles}>>{cider_and_beer_bottles}

If the number of bottles in the van was {total_bottles}, then {total_bottles}-{cider_and_beer_bottles} =<<{total_bottles}-{cider_and_beer_bottles}={mixture_bottles}>>{mixture_bottles} contains a mixture of the two drinks.
At the first house, the delivery man dropped {delivery_fraction}*{only_cider_bottles} = <<{delivery_fraction}*{only_cider_bottles}={first_house_cider}>>{first_house_cider} bottles.

There were also {delivery_fraction}*{only_beer_bottles} = <<{delivery_fraction}*{only_beer_bottles}={first_house_beer}>>{first_house_beer} bottles of beer that the delivery man gave to the first house.

Together, the first house received {first_house_beer}+{first_house_cider} = <<{first_house_beer}+{first_house_cider}={first_house_cider_beer_total}>>{first_house_cider_beer_total} bottles of cider and beer

The total number of bottles that had a mixture of the two drinks that were dropped at the first house is {delivery_fraction}*{mixture_bottles} = <<{delivery_fraction}*{mixture_bottles}={first_house_mixture}>>{first_house_mixture}

The first house got {first_house_cider_beer_total}+{first_house_mixture} = <<{first_house_cider_beer_total}+{first_house_mixture}={total_bottles_first_house}>>{total_bottles_first_house} bottles of all types of drinks.
